column17: The bombing attack took place in the FIS shopping center in Vitez, Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bosnia and Herzegovina.
column18: 10/09/2008: On Thursday at 1240 noon, unknown assailants detonated an improvised explosive device inside a parcel in the FIS shopping center in Vitez, Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bosnia and Herzegovina. The bombing attack killed one security guard who opened the package, wounded seven civilians and caused an unknown amount of damage to the FIS shopping center. No claim of responsibility was made for the incident, although on 10/11/2008 on Saturday, police arrested three men in connection to the attack who were being charged with committing an act of terrorism.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: An improvised explosive device containing unknown explosives placed inside a parcel was used in the bombing attack.
column108: The bombing attack caused an unknown amount of damage to the FIS shopping center.
column127: \"\"Three Suspects in Bosnia Mall Blast Arrested"
column132: \"\"Number of Injured in Vitez Blast Reaches Seven"

column18: 10/09/2008: On Thursday, at a shopping center in Vitez, Bosnia, two assailants, Suvad Djidic and Amir Ibrahimi, carried out an improvised explosive device attack killing one and wounding three other civilians. No group claimed responsibility.

column18: 11/09/2008: On Sunday, in Gradac, Republika Srpska, Bosnia and Herzegovina, assailants threw one grenade into a Croat residence, damaging the residence but causing no injuries.  No group claimed responsibility.

column17: The attack took place at a police station in Bugojno.
column18: 06/27/2010: On Sunday night around 0450, a vehicle borne improvised explosive device detonated at a police station in Bugojno, Bosnia and Herzegovina, killing one officer, Tarik Ljubuskic, and wounding six others, including police officer Edina Hindic. The police station was damaged in the attack. Five suspects are being held for questioning in connection with the attack, including 26 year-old Haris Causevic, who was caught escaping the scene. It is believed that the attack may have been in retaliation for a court case against Rijad Rustempasic. No group claimed responsibility for the attack, however, it is believed that the Wahhabi movement is responsible.
column39: A police station was targeted in the attack.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: A vehicle borne improvised explosive device was used in the attack.
column108: The attack caused an unknown amount of property damage to the police station.

column17: The attack took place at the United States embassy in Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina.
column18: 10/28/2011: On Friday afternoon around 1500, in Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina, a 23-year-old gunman, identified as Mevlid Jasarevic, opened fire on the United States embassy building with an AK-47 rifle. One police officer was injured. Police returned fire and injured Mevlid before arresting him. There were no other casualties and no group claimed responsibility for the attack. Police believe that Mevlid acted alone.
column39: The US embassy in Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina
column64: The specific motive for the attack was the desire by the perpetrator to be killed by American non-Muslims.
column97: A Kalashnikov AK-47 automatic rifle was used in the attack.
column108: The attack caused an unknown amount of property damage.
